thinkers.name: Michael Levin
thinkers.context: Primary author discussing self-improvement, pattern formation, and cognition across biological systems

thinkers.name: Francis Baluška
thinkers.context: Researcher on cellular consciousness and cognitive processes in non-neural systems

thinkers.name: Arthur Reber
thinkers.context: Theorist of cellular cognition as primary source of biological order

thinkers.name: Paul Lyon
thinkers.context: Researcher examining cognition in simple organisms and cellular systems

thinkers.name: Fred Keijzer
thinkers.context: Collaborator on reframing cognition in biological systems

thinkers.name: Heinz von Foerster
thinkers.context: Pioneering theorist of cognitive tiles, memory, and information storage in chemical systems

thinkers.name: Karl Friston
thinkers.context: Developer of Free Energy Principle and Bayesian approaches to biological systems

thinkers.name: Giovanni Pezzulo
thinkers.context: Researcher on pattern formation and top-down models in biological systems

thinkers.name: Daniel Dennett
thinkers.context: Philosopher addressing consciousness, real patterns, and explanatory frameworks

thinkers.name: Francisco Varela
thinkers.context: Pioneer of embodied cognition and autopoietic theory

thinkers.name: Douglas Hofstadter
thinkers.context: Theorist of strange loops and cognitive models of consciousness

thinkers.name: Robert Rosen
thinkers.context: Theorist of anticipatory systems and complex biological organization

thinkers.name: Carlos Gershenson
thinkers.context: Researcher connecting scale-free biology with Buddhist philosophy

thinkers.name: Anil Seth
thinkers.context: Neuroscientist studying embodied basis of consciousness

thinkers.name: Donald Hoffman
thinkers.context: Theorist of evolutionary user interfaces and interface theory

thinkers.name: Francis Crick
thinkers.context: Pioneering neuroscientist studying neural correlates of consciousness

thinkers.name: Humberto Maturana
thinkers.context: Co-developer of autopoiesis theory and living systems framework

thinkers.name: William Miller
thinkers.context: Researcher proposing all biology as cognitive information processing

thinkers.name: Eva Jablonka
thinkers.context: Theorist of epigenetic inheritance and extended evolutionary synthesis

thinkers.name: Richard Dawkins
thinkers.context: Theorist of memes and selfish gene concept

thinkers.name: Alfred Whitehead
thinkers.context: Philosopher whose process philosophy influences biological thinking

thinkers.name: Christopher Fields
thinkers.context: Researcher on meaning-making and competency in biological systems

thinkers.name: Itzik Fried
thinkers.context: Neurosurgeon studying brain stimulation and consciousness

thinkers.name: Oliver Sacks
thinkers.context: Neurologist and writer on mind and neurological conditions

thinkers.name: Thomas Nagel
thinkers.context: Philosopher famous for 'what is it like to be' approach to consciousness

thinkers.name: Frank Heylighen
thinkers.context: Researcher on stigmergy, coordination, and emergent agency

thinkers.name: Josh Bongard
thinkers.context: Researcher on xenobots and living machines

thinkers.name: Dani Kriegman
thinkers.context: Co-developer of xenobots and living reconfigurable organisms

thinkers.name: Iain McGilchrist
thinkers.context: Neuroscientist on divided brain and cognition

thinkers.name: Mark Solms
thinkers.context: Neuroscientist connecting psychoanalysis with neurobiology of consciousness

thinkers.name: Randall Frost
thinkers.context: Poet referenced for understanding of pattern and meaning

thinkers.name: John Searle
thinkers.context: Philosopher addressing consciousness and intentionality

concepts.name: Cognition
concepts.context: Capacity for understanding, information processing, and goal-directedness present across biological scales

concepts.name: Bioelectricity
concepts.context: Non-genetic communication system governing pattern formation and morphogenesis

concepts.name: Developmental Bioelectricity
concepts.context: Reprogrammable circuits underlying embryogenesis, regeneration, and cancer

concepts.name: Regeneration
concepts.context: Biological capacity to restore complex structures and maintain anatomical homeostasis

concepts.name: Morphogenesis
concepts.context: Process of biological pattern and form generation at multiple scales

concepts.name: Agency
concepts.context: Capacity for self-directed action and goal-seeking behavior at various biological levels

concepts.name: Consciousness
concepts.context: Quality of subjective experience potentially distributed across biological systems

concepts.name: Resonance
concepts.context: Self-reinforcing pattern of interaction between elements of thought

concepts.name: Niche Construction
concepts.context: Process by which organisms modify their environment, leaving information that alters future behavior

concepts.name: Stigmergy
concepts.context: Coordination through environmental modification and memory; evolutionary analog of niche construction

concepts.name: Self
concepts.context: Fundamental Buddhist concept of no-self contrasted with biological notions of agency and identity

concepts.name: Memory
concepts.context: Information storage across genetic, epigenetic, bioelectric, and behavioral scales

concepts.name: Basal Cognition
concepts.context: Foundational cognitive capacities in simple organisms and cellular systems

concepts.name: Autopoiesis
concepts.context: Theory of self-producing living systems maintaining organization through continuous reorganization

concepts.name: Embodied Mind
concepts.context: Cognition fundamentally dependent on having a body and interaction with environment

concepts.name: Enaction
concepts.context: Theory that cognition arises through dynamic interaction between organism and environment

concepts.name: Homeostasis
concepts.context: Biological regulation maintaining stability of internal conditions despite external changes

concepts.name: Epigenetic Inheritance
concepts.context: Transmission of heritable information beyond DNA sequence across generations

concepts.name: Free Energy Principle
concepts.context: Framework proposing biological systems minimize surprise by predicting sensory input

concepts.name: Active Inference
concepts.context: Process where agents act to confirm predictions and minimize uncertainty

concepts.name: Integrated Information Theory
concepts.context: Theory measuring consciousness through integrated information in neural systems

concepts.name: Competency in Navigating Arbitrary Spaces
concepts.context: Invariant cognitive capacity to understand and move through diverse solution spaces

concepts.name: Morphological Coordination
concepts.context: Common ancestral function unifying neural and non-neural signaling

concepts.name: Plastic
concepts.context: Capacity of neural and biological systems to change and adapt

concepts.name: Anticipatory Systems
concepts.context: Systems modeling future states and acting based on predictions

concepts.name: Teleonomy
concepts.context: Apparent purposefulness and goal-direction in biological systems without teleology

concepts.name: Biosemiotics
concepts.context: Study of meaning-making and sign processes in biological systems

concepts.name: Process Philosophy
concepts.context: Philosophical framework emphasizing process and change over static entities

concepts.name: Downward Causation
concepts.context: Causal influence from higher organizational levels to lower levels

concepts.name: Emergence
concepts.context: Novel properties arising from complex systems that cannot be reduced to components

concepts.name: Confabulation
concepts.context: Generation of false or distorted memories without awareness of fabrication

concepts.name: Dissociative Identity Disorder
concepts.context: Condition involving fragmented identity and memory with potential implications for self-concept

concepts.name: Memory Through Metamorphosis
concepts.context: Retention of learned information across dramatic morphological reorganization

concepts.name: Planarian Regeneration
concepts.context: Model system for studying morphological memory and pattern restoration

concepts.name: Xenopus Tadpole
concepts.context: Model organism for studying pattern formation and developmental bioelectricity

concepts.name: Dukkha
concepts.context: Buddhist concept of fundamental suffering or unsatisfactoriness in conditioned phenomena

concepts.name: Interface Theory of Perception
concepts.context: Theory that perception is evolutionary interface rather than accurate representation

concepts.name: Artificial Life
concepts.context: Computational systems exhibiting properties of biological life

concepts.name: Polycomputing
concepts.context: Framework emphasizing read and write sides of agent interaction and information processing

concepts.name: Gradualism
concepts.context: Evolutionary principle of gradual change in species over time

concepts.name: Engrams
concepts.context: Physical substrates or patterns encoding memories in neural and biological systems

concepts.name: Heterophenomenology
concepts.context: Approach to studying consciousness by correlating reports with objective data

concepts.name: Strange Loop
concepts.context: Self-referential system creating consciousness through recursive feedback

concepts.name: Copycat Project
concepts.context: Computational model of analogy-making and conceptual fluidity

concepts.name: Extended Evolutionary Synthesis
concepts.context: Theoretical framework extending evolution beyond genetic factors to include development and environment

concepts.name: Hsp90 Capacitor
concepts.context: Molecular mechanism buffering genetic variation and enabling morphological evolution

concepts.name: Evolvability
concepts.context: Capacity of biological systems to generate adaptive variation

concepts.name: Collective Intelligence
concepts.context: Emergent intelligence arising from coordination of multiple agents or cells

concepts.name: Gene Regulatory Networks
concepts.context: Complex networks of genes regulating each other exhibiting memory and computation

concepts.name: Reservoir Computing
concepts.context: Computational approach using physical systems as information processing substrates

concepts.name: Artificial Embryogeny
concepts.context: Computational models simulating developmental processes

concepts.name: Cellular Competency
concepts.context: Capacity of cells to interpret signals and execute complex behaviors

concepts.name: Anatomical Homeostasis
concepts.context: Maintenance of consistent anatomical form through active regulation

concepts.name: Scale-Free Biology
concepts.context: Biological principles and organization patterns consistent across scales

concepts.name: Predictive Processing
concepts.context: Framework where brain generates predictions and uses prediction errors to update models

concepts.name: Bayesian Inference
concepts.context: Statistical inference framework used to model biological decision-making and pattern formation

concepts.name: Holobiosis
concepts.context: Concept of integrated communities of organisms as evolutionary units

concepts.name: Dissipative Structures
concepts.context: Ordered structures maintained by continuous energy dissipation

concepts.name: Meta-Stability
concepts.context: State of apparent stability that can shift to alternative stable states

concepts.name: Stress Response
concepts.context: Coordinated cellular response to stress signals affecting protein synthesis

concepts.name: Variational Ecology
concepts.context: Framework applying variational principles to ecological and conscious systems

concepts.name: Federated Inference
concepts.context: Inference process distributed across multiple agents or systems

concepts.name: Hard Problem of Consciousness
concepts.context: Challenge of explaining subjective experience from physical processes

concepts.name: Panpsychism
concepts.context: Philosophical position that consciousness or mental properties are fundamental

concepts.name: Minimal Physicalism
concepts.context: Framework positing minimal physical requirements for cognition and consciousness

concepts.name: Cooperation
concepts.context: Coordinated behavior between agents

concepts.name: Associative Learning
concepts.context: Learning through formation of associations between stimuli or events

concepts.name: Individuality
concepts.context: Nature of what constitutes a distinct individual organism

concepts.name: Cognitive Lens
concepts.context: Analytical framework examining systems from cognitive perspective

concepts.name: Coarse-Graining
concepts.context: Process of abstracting from fine details to higher levels of description

concepts.name: Memes
concepts.context: Units of cultural information analogous to genes

concepts.name: Tulpamancy
concepts.context: Practice of creating imaginary entities through focused visualization

concepts.name: Cyborg
concepts.context: Hybrid system combining biological and technological components

concepts.name: Hybrots
concepts.context: Motile living constructs combining biological cells with technological components

concepts.name: Xenobots
concepts.context: Programmable living organisms created through bioengineering

concepts.name: Epistemic Vulnerability
concepts.context: Foundational concept in enactive theory of knowledge dependence on embodied interaction

frameworks.name: Free Energy Principle
frameworks.creator: Karl Friston
frameworks.context: Unified brain theory proposing biological systems minimize free energy and prediction error

frameworks.name: Active Platonic Space
frameworks.context: Framework focusing on persistent deep patterns and their interactions rather than media

frameworks.name: Morphogenesis as Bayesian Inference
frameworks.creator: Kuchling, Friston, Georgiev, Levin
frameworks.context: Variational approach treating pattern formation as Bayesian inference problem

frameworks.name: Technological Approach to Mind Everywhere
frameworks.creator: Michael Levin
frameworks.context: Experimentally-grounded framework for understanding cognition in diverse embodiments

frameworks.name: Bayesian Mechanics
frameworks.creator: Ramstead, Friston, Heins, et al.
frameworks.context: Physics of and by beliefs relating Bayesian inference to physical systems

frameworks.name: Embodied Mind Framework
frameworks.creator: Varela, Thompson, Rosch
frameworks.context: Cognitive science framework integrating embodiment and Buddhist philosophy

frameworks.name: Autopoiesis Theory
frameworks.creator: Maturana, Varela
frameworks.context: Theory of self-producing living systems and organizational closure

frameworks.name: Enaction Framework
frameworks.creator: Varela, Thompson
frameworks.context: Theory that cognition arises through dynamic interaction between organism and environment

frameworks.name: Relevance Realization Framework
frameworks.creator: Vervaeke, Lillicrap, Richards
frameworks.context: Cognitive framework explaining how systems determine relevant information

frameworks.name: Interface Theory of Perception
frameworks.creator: Donald Hoffman
frameworks.context: Theory that perception is evolutionary interface optimizing fitness rather than accuracy

institutions.name: MIT
institutions.context: Publisher of works on embodied mind and complex systems

institutions.name: Harvard University
institutions.context: Institution referenced for consciousness and neurological research

institutions.name: MIT Press
institutions.context: Publisher of significant works in consciousness, AI, and cognitive science

questions.question: What is the nature of self and identity in biological systems?
questions.context: Buddhist concept of non-self versus biological agency and individuality

questions.question: How do patterns persist and propagate without reduction to mechanical processes?
questions.context: Question of whether agential patterns can be understood beyond purely mechanical frameworks

questions.question: Can resonance and cognitive patterns exist without requiring physical substrate?
questions.context: Whether thought patterns need cogniferous media or can be self-reinforcing

questions.question: What constitutes the fundamental units of evolution?
questions.context: Whether metabolic patterns rather than organisms are true evolutionary agents

questions.question: How do different cognitive systems recognize other minds?
questions.context: Question of observer-dependent vantage points for recognizing agency and cognition

questions.question: Are goals and goal-havers fundamentally distinct or part of a continuum?
questions.context: Philosophical question about nature of purposefulness in biological systems

questions.question: Can electromagnetic-like self-reinforcing patterns constitute true resonance without a medium?
questions.context: Question about nature of interaction patterns independent of substrate

questions.question: How do systems resist exploitation and permanent manipulation through data control?
questions.context: Risk of systems susceptible to permanent change through information manipulation

questions.question: What determines system's cognitive light cone and spatiotemporal understanding?
questions.context: How systems determine relevant events for understanding other systems

questions.question: Can all stable objects be understood as hub nodes rather than true agents?
questions.context: Whether organisms are patterns temporarily animated by media

questions.question: How do multiple organizational levels create unified consciousness?
questions.context: Integration of cognition across biological scales into unified experience

questions.question: What mechanisms enable biological pattern recognition and meaning-making?
questions.context: How living systems create and recognize meaningful patterns

questions.question: How is consciousness related to downward causation?
questions.context: Relationship between subjective experience and causal influence from higher levels

questions.question: Can technological augmentation alter fundamental identity and agency?
questions.context: Question of whether implants and technological integration change selfhood

questions.question: What role do different observers play in determining what counts as alive or conscious?
questions.context: Observer-dependence of biological and conscious categorization
